concise_definition: n. 尝试, 试图; v. 试图, 尝试, 审判

definitions.explanation_en: An attempt or effort to accomplish something, especially when success is uncertain or has not yet been achieved.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为达成某目标而做出的努力或尝试，尤其当成功尚不确定或尚未实现时。
definitions.example_en: She made three tries to solve the puzzle before giving up.
definitions.example_cn: 她在放弃之前尝试了三次来解开这个谜题。

definitions.explanation_en: In rugby or American football, a scoring play in which a player grounds the ball over the opponent's goal line.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在橄榄球或美式足球中，指球员将球压在对方球门线后方以得分的进攻动作。
definitions.example_en: The team scored a try after a brilliant breakaway run.
definitions.example_cn: 球队在一次精彩的突破后达阵得分。

definitions.explanation_en: To make an effort to do something, especially when the outcome is uncertain or challenging.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指努力去做某事，尤其当结果不确定或具有挑战性时。
definitions.example_en: I tried calling you yesterday, but your phone was off.
definitions.example_cn: 我昨天试着给你打电话，但你的手机关机了。

definitions.explanation_en: To subject someone or something to a legal process to determine guilt or validity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过法律程序来判定某人或某事是否有罪或是否有效。
definitions.example_en: The suspect was tried for theft in a federal court.
definitions.example_cn: 这名嫌疑人因盗窃在联邦法院受审。

comparison.analysis: “Attempt” (尝试) 更正式，强调有意识地发起一个行动，但不一定包含多次尝试的含义。它常用于书面语或正式语境，如“an attempt to escape”。而 “try” 更口语化，可指一次或多次尝试，语义更宽泛，也常用于日常表达。
“Test” (测试) 指为检验性能、质量或能力而进行的系统性评估，通常有明确的标准和目的，如考试或实验。而 “try” 更侧重于主观努力或尝试达成目标，不一定有评估意图。
“Experiment” (实验) 强调通过系统性操作来探索未知或验证假设，常用于科学或研究语境。它比 “try” 更结构化、更严谨。而 “try” 可以是随意的、非正式的尝试，不依赖方法论。
